our papers

  1. Cullen, S., Fan, J., Brugge, E., and Elga, A. (2018). Improving analytical reasoning and argument understanding: A quasi-experimental field study of argument visualization. npj: Science of Learning.
  2. Fan, J., Yamins, D., and Turk-Browne, N. (2018). Common Object Representations for Visual Production and Recognition. Cognitive Science. [code]
  3. Fan, J., Hutchinson, J.B., and Turk-Browne, N. (2016). When past is present: Substitutions of long-term memory for sensory evidence in perceptual judgments. Journal of vision.
  4. Fan, J., Turk-Browne, N., and Taylor, J. (2016). Error-driven learning in statistical summary perception.. Journal of experimental psychology: human perception and performance.
  5. Fan, J., and Turk-Browne, N. (2016). Incidental biasing of attention from visual long-term memory.. Journal of Experimental Psychology: Learning, Memory, and Cognition.
  6. Fan, J. (2015). Drawing to learn: How producing graphical representations enhances scientific thinking.. Translational Issues in Psychological Science.
  7. Fan, J., Yamins, D., and Turk-Browne, N. (2015). Common object representations for visual recognition and production.. In CogSci.
  8. Fan, J., and Suchow, J. (2014). The crowd is self-aware. Behavioral and Brain Sciences.
  9. Fan, J., and Turk-Browne, N. (2013). Internal attention to features in visual short-term memory guides object learning. Cognition.
  10. Fan, J. (2013). Can ideas about food inspire real social change? The case of Peruvian gastronomy. Gastronomica: The Journal of Food and Culture.
  11. Strange, B., Kroes, M., Fan, J., and Dolan, R. (2010). Emotion causes targeted forgetting of established memories. Frontiers in Behavioral Neuroscience.
  12. Sharot, T., Shiner, T., Brown, A., Fan, J., and Dolan, R. (2009). Dopamine enhances expectation of pleasure in humans. Current Biology.
